newsitem.title: USA: LPC-BT sets bank loan, bond issue for Huntsman.
newsitem.headline: LPC-BT sets bank loan, bond issue for Huntsman.

text.p: NEW YORK, Jan 8 (LPC) - Bankers Trust New York Corp is arranging bank loan and bond transactions totaling $480 million to fund Huntsman Corp's $600 million acquisition of Texaco Inc's remaining chemical operation in Texas, banking sources said.

The transaction is an example of the "one-stop shopping" approach that banks and investment banks are focusing on heavily, lenders said. In one-stop shopping, a financial institution leads several types of financing and provides advisory services, bankers said.

For Huntsman, BT has fully underwritten a $300 million senior bank loan while BT Securities Corp is lead arranger on a $180 million bond tranche, sources said. Both tranches will be marketed in February, sources added.
Chase Manhattan Bank and Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette were among the bidders vying for the mandate, a number of bankers said.
The $300 million, seven-year bank loan will be split between a $50 million revolving credit and a $250 million term loan, a banker said.
The acquisition will be orchestrated through a newly formed, as-yet unnamed division of Huntsman, sources said.
Texaco sold the bulk of its chemical business to Huntsman in 1994 for more than $1 billion.
